t: Praise*pn be to the Lord*s my Rock, who*ld trains my hands for war, my*ld fingers for battle.
He*ln is my loving God and my fortress, my*ld stronghold and my deliverer, my*ln shield, in whom I take refuge, who*ld subdues peoples under me.
Lord,*spn what are human beings that you care for them, mere*ld mortals that you think of them?
They*ln are like a breath; their*ld days are like a fleeting shadow.
Part*pn your heavens, Lord,*s and come down; touch*ld the mountains, so that they smoke.
Send*ln forth lightning and scatter the enemy; shoot*ld your arrows and rout them.
Reach*ln down your hand from on high; deliver*ld me and rescue me from*ln the mighty waters, from*ld the hands of foreigners
whose*ln mouths are full of lies, whose*ld right hands are deceitful.
I*pn will sing a new song to you, my God; on*ld the ten-stringed lyre I will make music to you,
to*ln the One who gives victory to kings, who*ld delivers his servant David. From*pn the deadly sword
deliver me; rescue*ld me from the hands of foreigners whose*ln mouths are full of lies, whose*ld right hands are deceitful.
Then*pn our sons in their youth will*ld be like well-nurtured plants, and*ln our daughters will be like pillars carved*ld to adorn a palace.
Our*ln barns will be filled with*ld every kind of provision. Our*ln sheep will increase by thousands, by*ld tens of thousands in our fields;
our*ld oxen will draw heavy loads. There*ln will be no breaching of walls, no*ld going into captivity, no*ld cry of distress in our streets.
Blessed*ln is the people of whom this is true; blessed*ld is the people whose God is the Lord.*s
